xwikidoc.creator: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.author: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: PDFViewer Macro Translations
xwikidoc.content: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.name=PDF Viewer ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.description=PDF Viewer based on Mozilla pdf.js ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.file.name=File ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.file.description=Name of the PDF file or absolute URL to the PDF file ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.document.name=Document ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.document.description=Reference to the XWiki document to which the file is attached. If not defined, the current document is used. If file argument is an absolute URL, this argument is ignored. ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.width.name=Width ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.width.description=The viewer width, in pixels. If not defined the default value will be used ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.height.name=Height ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.height.description=The viewer height, in pixels. If not defined the default value will be used ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.asauthor.name=Delegate my view right ### Missing: rendering.macro.pdfviewer.parameter.asauthor.description=If this value is true (or 1 or yes) and the viewing user has no access to the document containing the PDF file, the PDF file could still be viewed on behalf of your view right (if you have view right on the containing document obviously). ### Missing: pdfviewer.error.nodocument=The document [{0}] does not exists or you have no access to that document. ### Missing: pdfviewer.error.noattachment=The file attachment [{0}] does not exists in document [{1}]. ### Missing: pdfviewer.error.nofile=No PDF filename or absolute URL provided.
